title: STAGE: STEMMED ACCOMPANIMENT GENERATION THROUGH PREFIX-BASED CONDITIONING
author: Giorgio Strano (Sapienza University of Rome), Chiara Ballanti (Sapienza University of Rome), Donato Crisostomi (Sapienza University of Rome), Michele Mancusi (Sapienza University of Rome), Luca Cosmo (Ca' Foscari University of Venice), Emanuele Rodolà (Sapienza University of Rome), ...
relevance_why: This paper's methods can enhance audio generation tasks by integrating single-stem accompaniment generation strategies. Techniques like prefix-based conditioning could be leveraged for better audio representation and manipulation models in Haohe Liu's research.
background: The paper addresses the creation of musical accompaniments by generating a new audio stem from existing music mixes or metronome tracks while ensuring rhythmic coherence.
contribution: This paper introduces the STAGE model to solve the problem of generating single-stem instrumental accompaniments conditioned on a mixture, achieving improved coherence and audio quality.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods primarily generated music from scratch or needed explicit musical guidance, often lacking in layered composition integration.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work employs a lightweight fine-tuning approach with prefix-based conditioning that utilizes existing audio contexts without requiring complex models.

key_innovation: The introduction of a prefix-based conditioning mechanism allows the model to generate coherent musical layers that respect the rhythmic and harmonic structures of existing audio.
real_world_impact: This framework enhances interactive music creation tools for musicians, potentially leading to more efficient music production and collaboration. It can be directly applied in live performance settings or studio environments.
limitations: The paper notes limitations concerning the diversity of the training dataset, potentially affecting the model's adaptability to various musical styles.

new_terms.prefix-based conditioning: **Prefix-based conditioning** refers to a mechanism in which a model is prompted with a prefixed input, allowing it to leverage previous context for more coherent continuation, applicable in generative tasks.
new_terms.COCOLA score: **COCOLA score** is a metric designed to assess the harmonic and percussive coherence between a musical context and generated audio.

open_sourcing: Model checkpoints and source code are available at https://github.com/giorgioskij/stage.
